body:
Comment 3: 
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa372835(v=vs.85).aspx

2330 is file not writable. 

I can't give specific advice as I am not a windows user, but the general recommendations
of checking the permission of who may write to the directory your current Go install is
in, or possible where the installer stores its metadata may be useful.

As it also appears to fix many problems, please check/update/disable/remove your anti
virus software and try again.
_Status changed to **WaitingForReply**._
